image.altText: A woman pointing a hose with water coming out of it in to the air as she looks up.

props.synopsis: Communities on prepaid power meters face regular disconnections amid 40 degree-plus heat, meaning no aircon, food rotting in the fridge and long, hot walks to get reconnected.

title.children: Constant power denied to 65,000 customers forced to pay upfront or disconnect

image.altText: NT Police insignia on mud-splattered car door.

props.synopsis: An 11-year-old boy has died in a quad bike crash that also injured a 38-year-old man at a mango farm south of Darwin.

title.children: Boy, 11, dies in mango farm quad bike crash south of Darwin

image.altText: A shadowed figure behind a fence.

props.synopsis: As incarceration rates continue to soar in the Northern Territory, experts say mental health reform in the justice system is crucial for improving community safety in the long term.

title.children: Doctors warn mental health reforms needed to keep children out of prison

image.altText: A pregnant woman standing alongside two mums holding their babies, all three women are wearing serious facial expressions.

props.synopsis: Women who have had traumatic birth experiences at Royal Darwin Hospital have gathered to share their stories and call for urgent action from the territory and federal governments.

title.children: 'It shouldn't be about luck': These women fear giving birth again in the NT

image.altText: A jockey on a horse smiling, leaning forward to pat its head, with a crowd in the background.

props.synopsis: Two years after a near-fatal fall, 25-year-old Alice Springs-born jockey has had a bumper season with 32 wins. Now he is riding in the Melbourne Cup.

title.children: Alice Springs jockey to ride in Cup two years after near-fatal fall

image.altText: Two women standing out the front of a women's shelter.

props.synopsis: An Aboriginal-led domestic violence support service is demanding answers over stalled progress in establishing a women's shelter in remote Northern Territory.

title.children: Women's shelter demands answers from government, land council

image.altText: A woman wearing a visor and holding a tennis racket stands in a tennis court next to a loop fence.

props.synopsis: The impending departure of Rio Tinto raises concerns about the future of sporting clubs in Nhulunbuy. But there are hopes increased investment in regional sports can help sustain the community's active lifestyle.

title.children: Sporting clubs fear the worst as mining giant withdraws from Nhulunbuy

image.altText: A train stops next to a platform while man in a hazmat suit walks alongside it

props.synopsis: British police are not treating a mass stabbing attack on a London-bound train as an act of terror. It left at least 11 people in hospital, some in critical condition.

title.children: Police say British man only suspect in train attack, praise 'heroic' staff

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: The father of murdered childcare worker Molly Ticehurst breaks down while expressing his frustration at the delays in the case against her alleged killer.

title.children: Court delays bring 'sadness and heartache' to Molly Ticehurst's family

image.altText: Andrew Mountbatten Windsor in a black suit and tie wearing military medals, standing alongside a UK policeman and royal guard

props.synopsis: Andrew Mountbatten Windsor will be stripped of his last remaining military position as part of King Charles's decision to remove him from public life, according to the UK defence minister.

title.children: Former Prince Andrew to be stripped of UK military rank

image.altText: A tradie buying and renovating homes at a home inspection.

props.synopsis: Australia's property market is heating up again, with record auctions over spring, and the return of both first home buyers and investors pushing up house prices.

title.children: First-time buyers turning to cheaper investments

image.altText: A man who died

props.synopsis: The death of a Brisbane man after a storm shone a spotlight on the dangers of overhead powerlines in a storm-prone state.

title.children: A good citizen tried helping after a storm. Then a powerline killed him

image.altText: cloud over mountain

props.synopsis: About 50,000 people climb Bluff Knoll in WA's Stirling Range each year, and emergency services say they are being called to more rescues as hikers underestimate the challenging track.

title.children: More hikers getting stuck on popular trail as social media draws tourists

image.altText: hail falling

props.synopsis: Hundreds of residents remain without power after Saturday's wild storms, while others are tallying the cost of giant hail to their properties, cars and homes.

title.children: South-east Queensland hit by two consecutive days of giant hail

image.altText: People walking past a Westpac sign.

props.synopsis: A strong result from Amazon pushes Wall Street high, and the ASX is set to open flat this morning as Westpac kicks off bank reporting. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Westpac sells off RAMS home loan business as profit dips

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX shares lift on ex-RBA governor appointment
Oil rises after OPEC+ pauses production hikes next year

image.altText: A jockey looks to his right and smiles as he rides his horse towards the line in the Melbourne Cup.

props.synopsis: From quiet beginnings, an unknown English filly came Down Under and changed Australia's racing history by achieving the impossible. This is how Makybe Diva won a historic third Melbourne Cup, 20 years ago.

title.children: 'A champion becomes a legend': Makybe Diva's 'impossible' third Cup win

image.altText: An older woman with short white hair sits in a living room looking serious.

props.synopsis: From today Canberrans like Gail Ford will be able to apply for the ACT's new voluntary assisted dying scheme, which its advocates say gives dignity in death to applicants.

title.children: Gail wants the choice to 'die with dignity'. From today she can

image.altText: A black-and-white map showing the village of Kholm in Afghanistan's north.

props.synopsis: It is unclear how many people have died following an earthquake in northern Afghanistan, two months after a tremor killed more than 2,200 people.

title.children: Magnitude-6.3 earthquake hits Afghanistan

image.altText: PROXY 1 River Region Early Education

props.synopsis: Daycare droughts are all too common in regional Australia, but in one New South Wales town, the shortage is so acute, the community is cracking.

title.children: 'Families in tears' as daycare drought keeps workers out of jobs

image.altText: Snowy mountain landscape with a glacier between two rocky peaks under an overcast sky.

props.synopsis: The avalanche struck the German climbers as they headed for the summit of Cima Vertana about 4pm on Saturday at an altitude of more than 3,500 metres.

title.children: Father and daughter among five killed in Italian Alps avalanche

image.altText: A street with cars parked diagonally on the sides.

props.synopsis: A $500 million accommodation plan in the Pilbara gets the green light from the regional Development Assessment Panel and will now go to the Town of Port Hedland for approval.

title.children: Plan for 1,300-room worker accommodation in WA heads to final stage of approval

image.altText: A dimly lit pokies room with bright colourful lights coming from each of the machines.

props.synopsis: There are calls for football teams to distance themselves from poker machines after data found more than $110 million was lost at venues owned by football clubs and leagues in the last financial year.

title.children: Each day, these football-owned poker machines rake in more than $300k

image.altText: A white 4WD with Red Cross symbols on the bonnet and side door, adorned with a Red Cross flag, in the headlights of other cars

props.synopsis: Israel says Hamas has handed over the remains of three hostages held in Gaza, as a fragile month-old ceasefire with the terror organisation continues to hold.

title.children: Remains of three hostages held in Gaza return to Israel

image.altText: an artists's illustration of a redesign of sydney's glebe island bridge

props.synopsis: Beneath Sydney's Anzac Bridge lies a lesser-known, heritage-listed landmark that has been dormant for three decades.

title.children: Renewed push to revive historic 'old swing bridge' sitting idle for 30 years

image.altText: GettyImages-2244582910

props.synopsis: The Storm says Eli Katoa had surgery after suffering "seizure activity" following multiple head knocks in the Tonga and New Zealand clash.

title.children: Storm star undergoes surgery after multiple head knocks in Tonga clash

image.altText: GettyImages-2244459362

props.synopsis: Matildas Sam Kerr and Ellie Carpenter both score for Chelsea in an impressive performance from the Australian stars.

title.children: Kerr scores for Chelsea as manager says Matildas star is gaining confidence

image.altText: An armed guard standing outside the glass entrance to the Louvre.

props.synopsis: Four thieves raided the world's most-visited art museum last month, in broad daylight, taking just seven minutes to steal jewellery worth an estimated $150 million before fleeing on scooters.

title.children: Louvre heist suspects believed to be small-time criminals

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: Three arrests have been made in two separate incidents in regional South Australia, one in which a man allegedly lit a fire before throwing a rock at firefighters and another involving a car being discovered in flames after allegedly leaving a "trail of destruction" on a property.

title.children: Charges laid after 'trail of destruction' and rock thrown at firefighters in regional SA

image.altText: GettyImages-2239334612

props.synopsis: Gold Coast tennis star Kimberly Birrell loses in the Chennai Open final but claims a sportsmanship award for touching moment.

title.children: Aussie Birrell loses Chennai Open final but earns award for sporting gesture

image.altText: Father and son celebrate after finishing yacht race.

props.synopsis: It has been almost 20 years since Ken Gourlay became the fastest Australian to sail solo, non-stop and unassisted around the world. Now, his son is aiming to break the record.

title.children: Dad's words of wisdom to son ahead of solo around the world sail

image.altText: Canavan speaks in a courtyard surrounded by a crowd of politicians.

props.synopsis: The Nationals have formally abandoned a commitment to reach net zero emissions by 2050, setting a challenge for Opposition leader Sussan Ley whether to follow or risk splitting the Coalition.

title.children: 'Found our voice': Nationals abandon net zero by 2050 climate promise

image.altText: Building exterior with Australian emblem, signage.

props.synopsis: The use of artificial intelligence to prepare court documents raises questions in the legal profession about its use and misuse in the industry.

title.children: Legal errors raise questions over AI use in Victorian courtrooms

image.altText: Three little penguins bunched together on sand

props.synopsis: The small, fragile colony of surviving little penguins on South Australia's Granite Island records a "significant increase" in numbers amid the state's harmful algal bloom.

title.children: 'Very fat' baby penguins raise hopes for SA colony despite algal bloom
